name: mri_synthsr_hyperfine
author: FreeSurfer Developers
description:
FreeSurfer is a software package for the analysis and visualization of neuroimaging data from cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. It is developed by the Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging.

FreeSurfer provides full processing streams for structural and functional MRI and includes tools for linear and nonlinear registration, cortical and subcortical segmentation, cortical surface reconstruction, statistical analysis of group morphometry, diffusion MRI, PET analysis, and much more. It is also the structural MRI analysis software of choice for the Human Connectome Project.

inputs.description: T1 image(s) to super-resolve, at native 1.5x1.5x5 axial resolution. Can be a path to an image or to a folder.
inputs.name: T1 Image

inputs.description: T2 image(s). Must be a folder if --t1 designates a folder. These must be registered to the T1s, in physical coordinates (i.e., with the headers, do NOT resample when registering; see instructions on FreeSurfer wiki)
inputs.name: T2 Image

inputs.description: Output(s), i.e. synthetic 1mm MP-RAGE(s). Must be a folder if --t1 designates a folder.
inputs.name: Output

inputs.description: (optional) Number of cores to be used. Default is 1.
inputs.name: Threads

inputs.description: (optional) Enforce running with CPU rather than GPU.
inputs.name: CPU Flag

output-files.description: Synthetic 1mm MP-RAGE(s) generated from T1 and T2 inputs
output-files.name: Synthetic MP-RAGE
